answers.answer:
DeCleanup Network contributes to the OSS ecosystem by introducing an innovative model that combines real-world environmental impact with decentralized Web3 incentives. Our dApp allows individuals and communities to self-tokenize their cleanup efforts, creating measurable and tradable environmental impact assets.

Specific contributions to the OSS ecosystem include:
- Decentralized proof of impact: We provide an open-source model for submitting and verifying real-world environmental actions using staking-based community validation, creating a trustless system for impact tracking.
- Incentivized environmental action: By tokenizing cleanups into dynamic Impact Products (dIPs), we create a sustainable incentive model that combines DeFi rewards with social impact.
- Community-driven growth: The DeCleanup dApp allows for decentralized governance and reward distribution, reinforcing open-source principles of collective ownership and transparent decision-making.
- Partnership-driven expansion: We’ve established partnerships with ReFi DAO, GreenPill Network, Aqua Purge Web3, and other environmental organizations, promoting cross-project collaboration and building a unified Web3 impact ecosystem.
- Open-source codebase: Our backend (Express.js), frontend (Next.js), and smart contracts (Solidity) are open-source, allowing developers to contribute and improve the platform.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.

answers.answer:
DeCleanup Network stands out from other environmental or social impact platforms due to its decentralized, incentive-driven model and dynamic, gamified structure:

- Proof of Impact (PoI) Verification:
Users submit geotagged before/after photos of cleanup efforts through the dApp.
Submissions are verified through a hybrid model: initially team-based, transitioning to community-based staking validation.
- DeCleanup Impact Products:
Dynamic NFTs that reflect the user’s cleanup history and impact level.
Soulbound and non-transferable, reinforcing proof-of-ownership and authenticity.
Metadata evolves based on cleanup frequency, increasing Impact Value and reward potential.
- Tokenized Incentives:
Earn $DCU for verified cleanups and referrals.
Convert $DCU 1:1 into $DCU tokens at TGE.
Streak-based rewards and bonus multipliers for consistent participation.
- Impact Circles (Collaborative Cleanups): next editions
Multiple users contribute to a shared cleanup goal.
Optional aligned token reward pools (e.g., $USDGLO) provide additional incentives.
Recognizes campaign leaders and distributes shared rewards based on impact value.
- Community Governance and Staking (next editions):
Staking $DCU tokens grants access to governance roles and higher reward tiers.
Validators stake tokens to vote on Proof of Impact verification.
Slashing mechanisms ensure accountability and prevent fraud.
Regen Bazaar Integration (next editions):
Impact Products can be staked on Regen Bazaar to earn additional $REBAZ tokens.
Introduces a DeFi-powered sustainability economy where environmental contributions generate financial value.
How It’s Differentiated:
- First platform to tokenize environmental cleanup efforts using decentralized governance.
- Combines social impact, gamification, and DeFi incentives in a single model.
- Transparent and community-driven reward distribution model.
- Real-world environmental action backed by on-chain verification and asset evolution.

answers.answer:
Our development roadmap is focused on expanding the network, enhancing the reward model, and transitioning to full decentralization:

Phase 2 – Expansion and Decentralization (Current Focus):
- Transition to a staking-based decentralized verification system.
- Expand to additional chains: Superchain Eco and Polygon zkEVM.
- Build advanced UX/UI features (e.g., user dashboards, leaderboards, and streak tracking).
- Build Impact Circle mechanics and allow campaign-specific reward pools.
- Introduce reward multipliers for high-impact cleanups.

Phase 3 – Full Decentralization and Cross-Chain Expansion:

- Enable governance where $DCU holders vote on staking APY and Impact Circle funding.
- Develop multi-chain compatibility with other chains, such as Supra, Stellar, and Starknet.
- Issue multi-chain POAPs as proof of environmental contribution across blockchains.
- Establish an ambassador program to drive global adoption and community growth.

Use of Grant Funds:

- Smart Contract Audits: Ensure secure reward distribution and staking.
- Development: Build cross-chain compatibility and advanced reward mechanics.
- Onboarding Incentives: Provide additional rewards for early contributors and validators.
- Community Growth: Fund ambassador program and regional cleanup events.
- Education & Outreach: Promote environmental impact awareness and increase adoption.

project.title: Decentralized Cleanup Network
project.description:
DeCleanup Network is a global community of impact creators working together to drive measurable environmental change. Our mission is to motivate individuals and communities worldwide to engage in environmental cleanups while ensuring their contributions are recognized, rewarded, and verifiable through Web3 technology.

At its core, DeCleanup Network leverages the power of community action, decentralized incentives, and transparent proof-of-impact verification. The core product, the DeCleanup dApp serves as a tool that empowers participants to self tokenize their real-world environmental efforts, creating a cycle of positive impact and rewards.

DeCleanup dApp allows participants to:
- Submit proof-of-impact (before/after geotagged photos) for cleanups.
- Mint DeCleanup Impact Products - onchain commodities in a shape of dynamic NFTs, representing verified impact.
- Earn $DCU for verified cleanup actions, with bonuses for streaks, referrals, and high-impact cleanups.
- Track their environmental contributions on dashboard, check progress of other users through a dynamic leaderboard and ranking system.

## Problem We Solve:
Environmental pollution and waste accumulation are global challenges. Most cleanup efforts depend on volunteer work with limited recognition, minimal incentives, and no standardized tracking. DeCleanup Network introduces a gamified, transparent, and scalable solution by rewarding real-world impact through tokenized assets and decentralized verification.

## How Will It Work in V2.1
**Proof of Impact (PoI) Submission:**
- Participants submit geotagged before/after photos via the DeCleanup dApp.
- Verification in Phase 1 is team-based; Phase 2 introduces decentralized staking-based verification.
**Tokenized Impact:**
- Verified cleanups are minted into DeCleanup Impact Products - ERC-721 tokens reflecting cleanup history and impact value.
- DeCleanup Impact Products have evolving traits (Level, Impact Value) based on user performance.
**Rewards & Incentives:**
- Participants earn $DCU convertible to $DCU tokens at TGE.
- Streak bonuses, leaderboard rankings, and referral multipliers drive engagement.

**Open-Source Development Progress**
DeCleanup Network has actively engaged with the open-source developer community to build a scalable and decentralized platform. We have participated in two major hackathons through the [OnlyDust platform](https://onlydust.com), accelerating progress toward a fully decentralized and user-friendly dApp.

**ODBoost (Jan 2025) – Foundational Stage**
In the first hackathon, the focus was on establishing a strong foundation for the dApp’s architecture, organizing the development workflow, and preparing for future scalability.

Key Achievements
- Project Maintainers Recruited: Identified and onboarded experienced Web3 developers through the OnlyDust platform.
- Established contribution guidelines and developer onboarding processes.
- Opened GitHub issues to enable new contributors to work on specific features.
- dApp V2 Figma Design Completed: Finalized comprehensive UI/UX design for dApp V2, focusing on user experience and seamless cleanup submission flow.
- Established the foundational smart contract logic for $DCU (ERC-20) and DeCleanup Impact Product (ERC-721).
- CI/CD & security enhancements
- Designed to support scalable reward distribution and real-time metadata updates.
- Created detailed GitHub issues aligned with V2.1 specifics to support organized and transparent contributions.
- Established a roadmap for future milestones and feature expansions.

**ODBuild (Feb 2025) – The Coordination** 
In the second hackathon we participated in, the focus shifted toward implementing core backend functionality and initiating smart contract integration while coordinating with open-source contributors.

Key Achievements:
- Created initial logic for staking, reward calculation, and metadata progression.
- Organized the backend repository to support future development and integration with the frontend.
- Established clear code architecture for Proof of Impact processing and reward allocation.
- Began analyzing pull requests from contributors related to $DCU and DeCleanup Impact Product contracts.
- Designed most of the elements of the frontend, preparing it with integration with smart contracts.
- Coordinated with contributors to fix bugs, improve logic, and align with reward distribution mechanisms.

**Upcoming OD Hackathon (March 2025) – Finalization and Pre-Launch Readiness**
The March 2025 hackathon will focus on finalizing the product across all key components - smart contract, backend, and frontend - to prepare for a successful public launch. The goal is to integrate, test, and optimize all technical layers, ensuring that the platform is scalable, secure, and user-friendly.

Key Goals:
- Backend Infrastructure Completion:
Finalize the backend architecture.
Implement transaction handling for cleanup submissions, reward distribution, and metadata updates.

- Proof of Impact Verification & Automation - develop a secure submission flow with:
1. Geotag and timestamp verification.
2. Photo consistency checks (framing, background objects).
3. Anti-fraud detection to prevent duplicate or manipulated submissions.
4. Automate metadata updates upon cleanup verification.
5. Ensure data integrity and security in the verification process.

- Smart Contract Completion and Optimization: finalize and deploy smart contracts for:
1. $DCU (ERC-20): Handle staking, reward calculation, and slashing.
2. DeCleanup Impact Products (ERC-721): Establish metadata progression and reward multipliers.
3. Optimize gas fees to reduce transaction costs.
4. Secure the mint function to prevent unauthorized minting or supply manipulation.

- Gamification & User Incentives: create a real-time leaderboard to track cleanup activity and user ranking and implement: 
1. Streak-based bonuses for consistent participation.
2. Referral tracking to reward network growth.
3. Reward multipliers based on Impact Value and cleanup frequency.

- UX/UI Optimization:
1. Improve frontend performance and simplify user onboarding.
2. Finalize mobile responsiveness and navigation flow.
3. Create a streamlined claiming process for DeCleanup Impact Products.

The March hackathon will serve as the final technical milestone before public launch, focusing on scalability, security, and user experience. This phase will align the backend, frontend, and smart contracts into a cohesive, integrated platform - setting the foundation for global adoption and decentralized community governance.

## Roadmap
Phase 2 – Expansion and Decentralization (In Progress):
- Transition to staking-based community verification model.
- Multi-chain expansion (Superchain Eco, Polygon zkEVM).
- Enhanced incentives and gamification (Impact Circles, referral multipliers).
- Regen Bazaar integration for Impact Products staking and trading.

Phase 3 – Full Decentralization and Cross-Chain Expansion (2025):
- Full community governance model.
- Cross-chain compatibility with other chains, including Supra and Stellar.
- Enhanced impact metrics (CO2 offset, waste removed, location significance).

Phase 4 – Future Evolution:
- Global ambassador program.
- Token liquidity provision.

- DeCleanup Network Pitchdeck: [open](https://www.canva.com/design/DAGf53DDD2w/vPpp5UvG3f-9rHCDJpylKA/view?utm_content=DAGf53DDD2w&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link2&utm_source=uniquelinks&utlId=h8467560098)
- DApp V2.1 Figma design: [open](https://www.figma.com/design/gcIv3YALbv8eFTJjXm3aUK/DCU-%E2%80%94-V2-(Copy)?node-id=0-1&t=lNZyY6zfO7qvKXgD-1)
- Full flow prototype of the next versions: [open](https://www.canva.com/design/DAGa70P3H9I/g2rqJn8-hsOxOeyy8yqE4g/view?utm_content=DAGa70P3H9I&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link2&utm_source=uniquelinks&utlId=h7ae241b0bb)
